types.name: AppSubscriptionStatus

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The app subscription is pending approval by the merchant.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been approved by the merchant and is ready to be activated by the app. App subscriptions created through the GraphQL Admin API are activated upon approval.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The app subscription has been activated by the app. Active app subscriptions are charged to the store and partners recieve payouts for active app subscriptions.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was declined by the merchant.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was not accepted within 2 days of being created.

enumValues.name: FROZEN
enumValues.description: The app subscription is on hold due to a store subscription non-payment. The charge will re-activate once subscription payments resume.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The app subscription was cancelled by the app.

types.name: BulkOperation
types.description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` mutation. After they are created,
clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

See the [bulk operations guide](https://help.shopify.com/api/guides/bulk-operations) for more details.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was successfully completed.

type.name: DateTime
type.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55Z"`.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the bulk operation was created.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: Error code for failed operations.

type.name: BulkOperationErrorCode
type.description: Error codes for failed bulk operations.

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: File size in bytes of the file in the `url` field.

type.name: UnsignedInt64
type.description:
An unsigned 64-bit integer. Represents whole numeric values between 0 and 2^64 - 1 encoded as a string of base-10 digits.

Example value: `"50"`.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: objectCount
fields.description: The running count of objects processed. This can be used to track operation progress.

fields.name: partialDataUrl
fields.description:
URL to partial/incomplete response data (in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format) returned by a failed operation.
Expires **one week** after the operation fails. Returns `null` when there's no data available.

type.name: URL
type.description:
An RFC 3986 and RFC 3987 compliant URI string.

Example value: `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"`.

fields.name: query
fields.description: GraphQL query document specified in `bulkOperationRunQuery`.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the bulk operation.

fields.name: url
fields.description:

type.name: BulkOperation
type.description:
An asynchronous long-running operation to fetch data in bulk.

Bulk operations are created using the `bulkOperationRunQuery` mutation. After they are created,
clients should poll the `status` field for updates. When `COMPLETED`, the `url` field contains
a link to the data in [JSONL](http://jsonlines.org/) format.

See the [bulk operations guide](https://help.shopify.com/api/guides/bulk-operations) for more details.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

types.name: BulkOperationErrorCode
types.description: Error codes for failed bulk operations.

enumValues.name: ACCESS_DENIED
enumValues.description:
The provided operation `query` returned access denied due to missing
[access scopes](https://help.shopify.com/api/getting-started/authentication/oauth/scopes).
Review the requested object permissions and execute the query as a normal non-bulk GraphQL request to see more details.

enumValues.name: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
enumValues.description: Operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to internal server errors during execution.

enumValues.name: TIMEOUT
enumValues.description:
Operation resulted in partial or incomplete data due to query timeouts during execution.
In some cases, timeouts can be avoided by modifying your `query` to select fewer fields.

types.description:
Represents information about a customer of the shop, such as the customer's contact details, their order
history, and whether they've agreed to receive email marketing.

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

fields.name: canDelete
fields.description:
Whether the merchant can delete the customer from their store.

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

type.name: URL
type.description:
An RFC 3986 and RFC 3987 compliant URI string.

Example value: `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"`.

fields.name: source

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

enumValues.description: Send a cancellation request to the fulfillment service of a fulfillment order. The corresponding mutation for this action is FulfillmentOrderSubmitCancellationRequest.

enumValues.description: Open an external URL to initiate the fulfillment process outside Shopify.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderRequestStatus

enumValues.name: UNSUBMITTED
enumValues.description:
The initial request status for the newly created fulfillment orders. This is the only valid
request status for fulfillment orders that aren't assigned to a fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: SUBMITTED
enumValues.description: The merchant requested fulfillment for this fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service accepted the merchant's fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: REJECTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service rejected the merchant's fulfillment request.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REQUESTED
enumValues.description: The merchant requested a cancellation of the fulfillment request for this fulfillment order.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_ACCEPTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service accepted the merchant's fulfillment cancellation request.

enumValues.name: CANCELLATION_REJECTED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service rejected the merchant's fulfillment cancellation request.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment service closed the fulfillment order without completing it.

types.name: FulfillmentOrderSortKeys

enumValues.name: RELEVANCE
enumValues.description:
During a search (i.e. when the `query` parameter has been specified on the connection) this sorts the
results by relevance to the search term(s). When no search query is specified, this sort key is not
deterministic and should not be used.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment order has been cancelled by the merchant.

enumValues.name: INCOMPLETE
enumValues.description: The fulfillment order cannot be completed as requested.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The fulfillment order has been completed and closed.

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

enumValues.description: There is no defined status for external marketing activities.

fields.name: sourceAndMedium
fields.description:
Where the `MarketingEvent` occurred and what kind of content was used.
Because `utmSource` and `utmMedium` are often used interchangeably, this is
based on a combination of `marketingChannel`, `referringDomain`, and `type` to
provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

type.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

inputFields.description: Currency of the money.

types.name: MoneyV2
types.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Decimal money amount.

fields.name: currencyCode

types.description: Online Store preview URL of the object.

fields.name: onlineStorePreviewUrl
fields.description: The online store preview URL.

type.name: URL
type.description:
An RFC 3986 and RFC 3987 compliant URI string.

Example value: `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"`.

types.name: Order
types.description: An order represents an agreement to do business between a customer and a merchant.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description:
Generated messages that appear at the top of an order page in the Shopify admin.
For example, _this is a test order_.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description:
Mailing address provided by the customer.
Not all orders have mailing addresses.

type.name: MailingAddress
type.description:
Represents a customer mailing address.

For example, a customer's default address and an order's billing address are both mailling addresses.

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer
fields.description: Whether notifications can be sent to the customer or not.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
Reason the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

type.name: OrderCancelReason
type.description: Represents the reason that the order is being canceled. Valid values are: customer, fraud, inventory, declined, other.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

type.name: DateTime
type.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55Z"`.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description:
Whether payment for the order can be captured.
Returns true when the customer's credit card has been authorized for payment and the authorization period has not expired.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

type.name: MoneyBag
type.description: A collection of monetary values in their respective currencies.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The ip address of the client that is associated with this order.

type.name: String
type.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order closed.
If the order is not closed, then this field is null.

type.name: DateTime
type.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55Z"`.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description:
The currency of the store at the time of the order.
If payment hasn't occurred, then this field is null.

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

enumValues.description: The format of the card number is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE
enumValues.description: The format of the expiry date is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CVC
enumValues.description: The format of the CVC is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_CVC
enumValues.description: The CVC does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ZIP
enumValues.description: The ZIP or postal code does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The address does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the payment.

enumValues.name: PICK_UP_CARD
enumValues.description: The card has been reported as lost or stolen, and the card issuer has requested that the merchant keep the card and call the number on the back.

enumValues.name: CONFIG_ERROR
enumValues.description: There is an error in the gateway or merchant configuration.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE_LIVE_CARD
enumValues.description: A real card was used but the gateway was in test mode.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
enumValues.description: The gateway or merchant configuration doesn't support a feature, such as network tokenization.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unknown error with processing the payment.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: The payment method is not available in the customer's country.

enumValues.name: INVALID_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The amount is either too high or too low for the provider.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The payment method is momentarily unavailable.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_CHARGED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been captured.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_REFUNDED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been refunded.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AUTHORIZATIONS_CAPTURED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 authorizations has been captured for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_REFUNDS_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 refunds has been processed for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_ORDER_REFERENCE_CANCELED
enumValues.description: The order was canceled, which canceled all open authorizations.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_STALE
enumValues.description: The order was not confirmed within three hours.

types.name: OrderTransactionInput
types.description: Specifies the information needed to create an order transaction.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The amount of money for this transaction.

inputFields.name: gateway
inputFields.description: The payment gateway to use for this transaction.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of transaction.

inputFields.name: orderId
inputFields.description: The ID of the order associated with the transaction.

inputFields.name: parentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the optional parent transaction, for example the authorization of a capture.

type.name: ID
type.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

inputFields.name: processedAt
inputFields.description: The time at which the transaction occurred.

type.name: DateTime
type.description: An ISO-8601 encoded UTC date time string. Example value: `"2019-07-03T20:47:55Z"`.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description: The source of the transaction.

type.name: String
type.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: OrderTransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved during the authorization stage.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description: A cancellation of a pending authorization or capture.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description:
A partial or full return of captured funds to the cardholder.
A refund can happen only after a capture is processed.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: Money returned to the customer when they have paid too much.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: SUGGESTED_REFUND
enumValues.description: A suggested refund transaction that can be used to create a refund.

types.name: OrderTransactionStatus
types.description: Transaction status' describe the status of a transaction.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

type.name: ID
type.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

types.name: ProductVariantInventoryPolicy
types.description: The inventory policy for a product variant controls whether customers can continue to buy the variant when it is out of stock. When the value is continue, customers are able to buy the variant when it's out of stock. When the value is deny, customers can't buy the variant when it's out of stock.

enumValues.name: DENY
enumValues.description: Stop selling a product variant when it is out of stock.

enumValues.name: CONTINUE
enumValues.description: Continue selling a product variant when it is out of stock.

type.name: MoneyV2
type.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReason
types.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's bank.

enumValues.name: FRAUDULENT
enumValues.description: The cardholder claims that they didnt authorize the payment.

enumValues.name: GENERAL
enumValues.description: The dispute is uncategorized, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: UNRECOGNIZED
enumValues.description: The customer doesnt recognize the payment appearing on their card statement.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_UNACCEPTABLE
enumValues.description: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_RECEIVED
enumValues.description: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_NOT_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you have not yet provided a refund or credit.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The customer account associated with the purchase is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank account has insufficient funds.

enumValues.name: BANK_CANNOT_PROCESS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot process the charge.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot proceed with the debit since it has not been authorized.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INITIATED
enumValues.description: The customer initiated the dispute, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Payouts will not be automatically made.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutSchedule
types.description: The payment schedule for a payments account.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

type.name: Int
type.description: Represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

type.name: DayOfTheWeek
type.description: Days of the week from Monday to Sunday.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

type.name: ID
type.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

type.name: ID
type.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

type.description: Represents textual data as UTF-8 character sequences. This type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives

fields.name: mutationType

type.name: __Type
type.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.
